newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgarian lev falls to 233 per dollar at close.
newsitem.headline: Bulgarian lev falls to 233 per dollar at close.

text.p: Bulgarian lev closed thin interbank trading at 233 per dollar, down from the opening between 229.50-231 and 227.50-229 at the previous close, dealers said.
"Four or five banks traded in the market today and all of them held the view that the lev will keep falling after the rate cut," a bank dealer said.
Because of the light volume, traders said even demand for small foreign currency volumes instantly pressures the lev.
Some dealers said the central bank was not seen intervening in support of the lev, but it might have offered limited volumes of foreign currency only to end clients.
Central bank officials were not available for comment.
A recent cut in the main interest rate has brought fresh pressure on the fragile lev this week dollar, said traders.
The central bank cut the rate to 20 percent monthly or 240 percent annually at the end of last week. -- Dessislava Popova, Sofia Newsroom, 359-2-84561
